page.title: 05WINTER HILL
page.content: Our survey on the southern edge of Winter Hill under Rivington Pike,Brown Hill and Crooked Edge found a large area of uncultivated moorland stretching to 1400 feet.Conservation Volunteers Trust have started to plant the western tip with rowans and conifers and there is one area of reclaimed farmland at Higher Knoll. The most significant natural feature is the River Douglas which has its source on these moors before forming the boundary of Greater Manchester and Lancashire as it makes its way westwards.Its flow is helped by the many land drains which the water boards,at first for Liverpool Corporation,have put in.Flat areas at the top of the moors are still very boggy.
